<ce:para view="all">Caution! Azide salts are potentially explosive and should be handled in small quantities and with adequate precautions.</ce:para><ce:section-title>Synthesis of compounds <ce:bold>1–3</ce:bold>
</ce:section-title><ce:section-title>Synthesis of Zn(pdtz)(4,4′-bipy)·3H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">Compound <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> was synthesized from a mixture of ZnCl<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> (0.068<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>g, 0.5<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>mmol), NaN<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> (0.039<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>g, 0.6<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>mmol), terephthalonitrile (TPN) (0.038<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>g, 0.3<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>mmol), 4,4′-bipy (0.047<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>g, 0.3<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>mmol), NaOH (0.01<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>g, 0.25<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>mmol) and H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (10<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>mL). This mixture was stirred for 20<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>min at room temperature. Then the above mixture was transferred into a Teflon-lined autoclave (20<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>mL) and kept at 120<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>°C for 3 days. After the reaction mixture had been slowly cooled at a rate of 10<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>°C<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>h<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> to room temperature, block-like colorless crystals of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> were obtained. The products were collected by filtration, washed with distilled water and dried in a desiccator at room temperature (yield: 58% based on Zn). Elemental analysis for C<ce:inf loc="post">18</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">18</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">10</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>Zn (<ce:italic>M<ce:inf loc="post">r</ce:inf>
</ce:italic>=487.81) (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>): calcd: C 44.32, H 3.72, N 28.71%; found: C 44.28, H 3.69, N 28.72%. Selected IR data (KBr pellet, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3348 (br), 1671 (m), 1612 (s), 1556 (m), 1535 (m), 1429 (s), 1272 (w), 1232 (m), 1170 (m), 1141 (m), 1071 (m), 1044 (m), 1009 (m), 865 (m), 817 (s), 751 (m), 727 (m), 647 (m), 545 (w), 491 (m), 460 (m).</ce:para><ce:section-title>Synthesis of [Zn(pdtz)(bpp)]<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·3H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">Compound <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> was prepared with a similar procedure to <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> except that 4,4′-bipy was substituted by bpp (0.059<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>g, 0.3<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>mmol). Block-like colorless crystals of <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> were obtained (yield: 62% based on the Zn). Elemental analysis for C<ce:inf loc="post">42</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">42</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">20</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>Zn<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> (<ce:italic>M<ce:inf loc="post">r</ce:inf>
</ce:italic>=1005.70) (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>): calcd: C 50.16, H 4.21, N 27.85%; found: C 50.13, H 4.18, N 27.88%. Selected IR data (KBr pellet, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3423 (br), 2075 (m), 1622 (s), 1558 (m), 1510 (w), 1437 (s), 1342 (w), 1229 (m), 1163 (m), 1141 (w), 1068 (m), 1038 (m), 1006 (m), 862 (m), 805 (m), 752 (m), 623 (w), 527 (w), 489 (m).</ce:para><ce:section-title>Synthesis of Zn(pdtz)0.5(N<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)(2,2′-bipy) (<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">Compound <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> was synthesized in an analogous manner to <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> except that 4,4′-bipy was replaced by 2,2′-bipy (0.047<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>g, 0.3<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>mmol) and a little more NaN<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> (0.046<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>g, 0.7<ce:hsp sp="0.16"></ce:hsp>mmol) was used during the preparation. Block-like colorless crystals of <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> were isolated (yield: 48% based on the Zn). Elemental analysis for C<ce:inf loc="post">14</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">10</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf>Zn (<ce:italic>M<ce:inf loc="post">r</ce:inf>
</ce:italic>=369.68) (<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>): calcd: C 45.49, H 2.73, N 34.10%; found: C 45.45, H 2.68, N 34.13%. Selected IR data (KBr pellet, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 2049 (s), 1597 (m), 1565 (m), 1492 (m), 1433 (s), 1336 (m), 1319 (m), 1288 (m), 1252 (w), 1181 (m), 1155 (w), 1055 (w), 1020 (m), 902 (w), 890 (m), 770 (s), 734 (m), 651 (m), 629 (w), 540 (w), 493 (m), 420 (m).</ce:para>
clean_text:
Caution! Azide salts are potentially explosive and should be handled in small quantities and with adequate precautions.

Synthesis of compounds 1-3 

Synthesis of Zn(pdtz)(4,4'-bipy)⋅3H2O (1)

Compound 1 was synthesized from a mixture of ZnCl2 (0.068g, 0.5mmol), NaN3 (0.039g, 0.6mmol), terephthalonitrile (TPN) (0.038g, 0.3mmol), 4,4'-bipy (0.047g, 0.3mmol), NaOH (0.01g, 0.25mmol) and H2O (10mL). This mixture was stirred for 20min at room temperature. Then the above mixture was transferred into a Teflon-lined autoclave (20mL) and kept at 120°C for 3 days. After the reaction mixture had been slowly cooled at a rate of 10°Ch-1 to room temperature, block-like colorless crystals of 1 were obtained. The products were collected by filtration, washed with distilled water and dried in a desiccator at room temperature (yield: 58% based on Zn). Elemental analysis for C18H18N10O3Zn (Mr =487.81) (1): calcd: C 44.32, H 3.72, N 28.71%; found: C 44.28, H 3.69, N 28.72%. Selected IR data (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3348 (br), 1671 (m), 1612 (s), 1556 (m), 1535 (m), 1429 (s), 1272 (w), 1232 (m), 1170 (m), 1141 (m), 1071 (m), 1044 (m), 1009 (m), 865 (m), 817 (s), 751 (m), 727 (m), 647 (m), 545 (w), 491 (m), 460 (m).

Synthesis of [Zn(pdtz)(bpp)]2⋅3H2O (2)

Compound 2 was prepared with a similar procedure to 1 except that 4,4'-bipy was substituted by bpp (0.059g, 0.3mmol). Block-like colorless crystals of 2 were obtained (yield: 62% based on the Zn). Elemental analysis for C42H42N20O3Zn2 (Mr =1005.70) (2): calcd: C 50.16, H 4.21, N 27.85%; found: C 50.13, H 4.18, N 27.88%. Selected IR data (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3423 (br), 2075 (m), 1622 (s), 1558 (m), 1510 (w), 1437 (s), 1342 (w), 1229 (m), 1163 (m), 1141 (w), 1068 (m), 1038 (m), 1006 (m), 862 (m), 805 (m), 752 (m), 623 (w), 527 (w), 489 (m).

Synthesis of Zn(pdtz)0.5(N3)(2,2'-bipy) (3)

Compound 3 was synthesized in an analogous manner to 1 except that 4,4'-bipy was replaced by 2,2'-bipy (0.047g, 0.3mmol) and a little more NaN3 (0.046g, 0.7mmol) was used during the preparation. Block-like colorless crystals of 3 were isolated (yield: 48% based on the Zn). Elemental analysis for C14H10N9Zn (Mr =369.68) (3): calcd: C 45.49, H 2.73, N 34.10%; found: C 45.45, H 2.68, N 34.13%. Selected IR data (KBr pellet, cm-1): 2049 (s), 1597 (m), 1565 (m), 1492 (m), 1433 (s), 1336 (m), 1319 (m), 1288 (m), 1252 (w), 1181 (m), 1155 (w), 1055 (w), 1020 (m), 902 (w), 890 (m), 770 (s), 734 (m), 651 (m), 629 (w), 540 (w), 493 (m), 420 (m).
